titleStmt.title: The fardle of facions conteining the aunciente maners, customes, and lawes, of the peoples enhabiting the two partes of the earth, called Affrike and Asia.
Omnium gentium mores. Book 1-2. English
titleStmt.author: Joannes, ca. 1485-1535.
Josephus, Flavius. Antiquitates Judaicae.
Waterman, William, fl. 1555?

publicationStmt.publisher: By Ihon Kingstone, and Henry Sutton,

notesStmt.note: The author, Johannes Boemus, is named on leaf *2v.
A translation of books 1 and 2 of: Omnium gentium mores.
The imprint date is in a slot in the sill of the woodcut frame.
Colophon additionally dated: The. xxii. daye of December.
"The treatise of Iosephus, conteyning the ordres, and lawes of the Iewes commune wealthe", a translation of book 4, chapter 8 of "Antiquitates Judaicae", leaves T7-Z2.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
